author: BreakingNews.ie
title: ‘Insulting’ to suggest Irish men were in Colombia for peace process – US official
text:
A suggestion that three republicans were on holiday in Colombia rather than training rebels was said to be “insulting to (the) intelligence” of diplomats, archive documents show.
There was concern at the time that the arrest of the so-called Colombia Three in 2001 could damage the Northern Ireland peace process.
The incident happened after the IRA agreed on a way of disabling its arsenal, following months of slow progress.
Colombian authorities alleged that the men were training members of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia, also known as Farc.
The men were convicted of training rebels and sentenced to 17 years in prison in 2004; they were granted amnesty in 2020 as part of Colombia’s peace process.
In 2022, it was reported that their amnesty had been revoked.
The Colombia Three have always denied wrongdoing, maintaining they were in the country to observe Colombia’s peace negotiations.
The three men, who were travelling on false passports, Niall Connolly, James Monaghan, and Martin McCauley, were arrested on August 11 2001 at Bogota International Airport.
In newly released State documents, the discussion between top Irish and US officials in the aftermath of the arrests show that the US Special Envoy for Northern Ireland Richard Haass was angry at the incident.
In a meeting between Mr Haas and Ireland’s Ambassador to the US Sean O hUiginn, he said the men were “not on vacation, they were not promoting a peace process”.
“It was not only implausible to try to put across such explanations but insulting to our intelligence.
“A far better course would be to admit that a mistake had been made and say that it would not happen again.
“It was far more likely that the detainees were involved in some kind of ‘transfer of knowhow about bomb-making’.”
A briefing document written for the Department of Foreign Affairs detailed a meeting in Washington DC between Mr Haass and Ireland’s Ambassador to the US Sean Ó hUiginn.
The document notes that the Irish and British governments were “obviously in stocktaking mode to work out a strategy in relation to developments in the peace process, including of course the Colombia dimension”.
“The benign explanation that the three might have been engaged in peace education was not sustainable.
“Rather the choice was from the malign menu, for example, of some kind of weapons dealing, testing or training,” the note dated September 7 2001 said.
The material can be viewed in the National Archives in file 2023/53/29

author: McKenna Snow
title: LA Archbishop Leads Interreligious Memorial Service for the City’s Homeless
text: CV NEWS FEED // Archbishop José Gomez led an interreligious memorial service for the deceased homeless persons in the city of Los Angeles, California last week, where he implored for the attendees “to see everyone as a child of God.” The second annual Homeless Persons’ Interreligious Memorial took place at the Cathedral of Our Lady of the Angels on December 21. [According](https://angelusnews.com/local/la-catholics/2023-cathedral-homeless/) to news outlet Angelus News, near the “altar were 1,665 battery-charged candles, bearing the names of each of the people identified by the LA County coroner’s office as having died on the streets from December 2022 through Nov. 3 of this year.” Attendees were encouraged to take a candle home after the service and pray for the person whose name was on the candle. Religious leaders from the Evangelical Lutheran Church of America, Orthodox, Bahá’í, Hindu, Jewish, and Mormon faith traditions spoke at the memorial and lit candles to honor the homeless who had died. The memorial prayer service, Gomez said, was a call “to reach across the boundaries that separate us from our neighbors, to recognize in each person the spark of the divine, to see everyone as a child of God.” “We need to bear one another’s burdens,” Gomez said. “We need to lift up our neighbors when they’ve fallen, bind their wounds, and find them a place to live. When one of us is suffering, we all suffer.” After the parable of the Good Samaritan from the Gospel was proclaimed at the service, Gomez said, “Jesus asks us tonight to see with ‘new eyes.’ He asks us to look at the ‘other’ and see a brother or a sister. Whatever the color of their skin, whatever their nationality, their language, or religion. Whatever their condition or their worldly status.” More than 200 people attended the memorial, and were also encouraged after the service to donate sleeping bags, blankets, and other items. The Society of St. Vincent de Paul Society and [SOFESA](https://www.sofesa.org/), an LA nonprofit organization that cares for the homeless and low-income helped organize the vigil. Before the memorial, the Los Angeles Archdiocesan Council of Catholic Women also held a community donation drive called “Hearts & Hats” that collected scarves and hats for the homeless. Council member Karen Akana told Angelus News, “It’s just remarkable that we have that many people on the streets who have passed away. It’s hard to believe that even tonight somebody is probably dying because it’s so cold outside. So we came down to pray for them.” Angelus News noted that in 2022 Los Angeles had an [estimated](https://www.foxla.com/news/los-angeles-homeless-count-2023) homeless population of 41,980, “making it the city with the largest homeless population in the country that year (that number grew to 46,260 this year). The number of homeless deaths in LA counted for this year’s memorial was over 200 more than the same time period in 2022.”

organizations.name: la archbishop leads interreligious memorial service

author: Our Reporter
title: A tale of tumbles and triumphs - The Shillong Times
text: Meghalaya’s Sporting Odyssey in 2023 By Our Reporter As the curtain falls on the sporting spectacle that was 2023, Meghalaya can look back at a rollercoaster of athletic achievements, heartbreaks, and a few wall-tumbling incidents – all delivered in the unique flavor that only our beloved state can provide. Let’s take a leisurely stroll down the memory lane of Meghalaya’s sporting escapades, shall we? January Jamboree: Kishan Lyngdoh’s Century and Football’s Farewell The year kicked off with Kishan Lyngdoh announcing his arrival on the cricketing scene with a resounding maiden first-class hundred. In the football fraternity, Meghalaya bid farewell to Aibok Kharpran, a stalwart associated with Shillong Lajong FC. The echoes of his contributions resonated in the hills. February’s Fables: Santosh Trophy Soiree and MMA Marvels Meghalaya etched its name in football history by reaching the Santosh Trophy semifinals for the first time, showcasing resilience and skill. Meanwhile, in the world of mixed martial arts, Raymond Johnny Kurbah donned the black belt with pride and became the first Khasi MMA fighter to be signed by a US-based agency, bringing a dash of international flair to our local talent pool. Marching into March: Meghalaya’s Football Prodigy’s Mancunian Sojourn Young Federick Kupar Kurbah, the footballing prodigy, lived every footballer’s dream with an exposure tour to the hallowed grounds of Manchester United, adding a touch of glamour to Meghalaya’s sporting narrative. April’s Awe: Jaden Pariat’s Podium Glory Jaden Pariat, the racing sensation from Meghalaya, made headlines by standing on the British F4 podium, marking a historic moment and securing a proud spot in the international racing circuit. May Magic: Lajong’s I-League Return and Bhutia’s Footballing Haven Shillong Lajong FC made a triumphant return to the I-League, stirring emotions and reaffirming their place in Indian football. Simultaneously, the legendary Baichung Bhutia added a feather to Meghalaya’s cap by launching the first residential football academy in the Northeast, elevating the footballing dreams of aspiring youngsters. June Jolts: The Wall’s Tumble and a Sporting Luminary’s Farewell June brought a mixture of embarrassment and sorrow as the retaining wall at the new PA Sangma Stadium in Tura decided to take a tumble, creating a moment that’ll be etched in our collective memories. The month also saw the passing of Chiranjib Choudhury, a sports administrator par excellence. July Jubilations: Elite Programs and Young Football Hopefuls The Super Elite Programme for athlete development took flight, promising to nurture Meghalaya’s brightest talents with international coaches. Young footballers Damaitphang Lyngdoh and Helen Nongtdu found themselves in the spotlight, making it to the 50-men probable list for the India U-23 football squad. August’s Acceleration: Jaden Pariat’s Ferrari Dreams Jaden R Pariat, the rising star of motorsport, earned an invitation to the prestigious Ferrari Driver Academy selection trials, showcasing the caliber that Meghalaya is producing on the global stage. September’s Snag: SSA Vice-President’s Departure The sporting fraternity mourned the loss of Dibus Marbaniang, a senior Vice-President in the Shillong Sports Association, leaving behind a legacy of dedication and service. October’s Ovation: Golf Glory and MFA Leadership Change October witnessed Johnwell G Momin qualifying to represent Meghalaya in golf at the National Games 2023, a moment of pride for the Tura Golfers Association. Meanwhile, Hamlet Dohling assumed the presidency, and Sunesh Syiem took over as the General Secretary of the Meghalaya Football Association. November’s Nexus: I-League’s Homecoming and National Games Ordeal Shillong Lajong FC brought the I-League back to Meghalaya, playing their first home game with enthusiasm at the SSA Stadium. However, the joy was tempered as Meghalaya returned empty-handed from the 37th National Games in Goa, the lone state without a medal. December’s Delight: Pohkseh SC Triumph The sporting year culminated with Pohkseh SC claiming the Shillong Sports Association’s Second Division title, adding a touch of local fervor to the December air. As the sun sets on 2023, Meghalaya’s sports enthusiasts can look back with a mix of pride, nostalgia, and a readiness for the next chapter in our sporting saga. Here’s to another year of triumphs, challenges, and the undying spirit of Meghalaya in the world of sports. Cheers!

author: Expedia Group, Fanatics Commerce
title: Expedia Group Welcomes Ramana Thumu as Chief Technology Officer
text:
SEATTLE, Oct. 17, 2024 /PRNewswire/ -- Expedia Group (NASDAQ: EXPE) announced the appointment of Ramana Thumu as the company's Chief Technology Officer. Ramana will lead Expedia Group's technology organization, overseeing engineering, data, artificial intelligence, cloud platforms, and security, while capitalizing on the company's tech and platform investments in recent years.
Expedia Group Welcomes Ramana Thumu as Chief Technology Officer
- By Expedia Group, Fanatics Commerce
- Updated

author: Press Release Distribution Service
title: ACIBADEM Healthcare Group Unveils Comprehensive Product Update with Enhanced Telemedicine and Specialized Healthcare Services | User | kanerepublican.com
text:
ACIBADEM Healthcare Group has launched expanded services focused on telemedicine and digital solutions, enhancing patient access to specialized care in cardiology, oncology, and neurology. The initiative includes 24/7 access to medical specialists, comprehensive care plans, and seamless support for international patients, ensuring personalized healthcare experiences.
Istanbul, Turkey - October 17, 2024 —
ACIBADEM Health care Group is thrilled to announce the launch of expanded services that significantly enhance patient access to world-class healthcare, with a renewed focus on telemedicine and digital healthcare solutions. This substantial product update makes it easier for both local and international patients to receive high-quality medical care from the comfort of their homes or while on the go. By integrating advanced technology with exceptional clinical expertise, ACIBADEM is redefining how healthcare is delivered and experienced.
The latest enhancements are anchored by the introduction of specialized centers dedicated to cardiology, oncology, and neurology. These centers leverage state-of-the-art medical technologies and innovative treatment modalities, ensuring that patients have access to cutting-edge care tailored specifically to their health needs. With a multidisciplinary team of experts on hand, ACIBADEM Healthcare Group is committed to empowering patients with comprehensive treatment options that fit their individual circumstances and health goals.
As part of this product update, ACIBADEM Healthcare Group is introducing an advanced digital platform that provides patients with 24/7 access to medical specialists. This means that whether it is routine inquiries, urgent care needs or ongoing treatment management, patients can easily connect with professionals who are dedicated to their care. The convenience of telemedicine is complemented by personalized care coordinators who can guide patients through complex healthcare decisions, ensuring that every patient feels supported throughout their healthcare journey.
One of the standout features of this update is what ACIBADEM refers to as "comprehensive care plans." These plans are meticulously designed around each patient’s unique healthcare needs and preferences. This patient-centric approach is enhanced by international patient services that provide seamless logistical support for those traveling to receive care. This includes multilingual staff who are fluent in numerous languages and are trained to assist patients in navigating their experiences at ACIBADEM's network of facilities.
For international patients, the experience is further enriched by seamless medical travel assistance services that address every aspect of a patient's visit, from initial consultations to postoperative care and follow-up appointments. This ensures a convenient, stress-free experience, allowing patients to focus on their well-being while receiving treatment from one of the world’s leading healthcare providers. ACIBADEM’s commitment to providing personalized care extends beyond just treatment; it aims to cultivate a compassionate and understanding environment for all patients.
As a prominent healthcare provider operating a robust network of hospitals and clinics across five countries, including 40 hospitals worldwide, ACIBADEM Health care Group has positioned itself as a leader in comprehensive healthcare services. With over 25,000 dedicated employees, the organization boasts a wealth of expertise and resources aimed at delivering unparalleled healthcare experiences tailored to meet the diverse needs of patients globally. ACIBADEM is dedicated to ensuring excellence in patient care, aligning with international healthcare standards that exemplify quality and safety.
In today’s fast-paced world, having access to swift medical assistance is more crucial than ever. The integration of telemedicine into ACIBADEM's healthcare framework not only enhances patient access but also streamlines the clinical workflow, allowing for quicker diagnosis and treatment initiation. This adaptation to modern healthcare demands positions ACIBADEM as a forward-thinking organization that embodies the future of healthcare delivery – one that harmonizes in-person care with the countless conveniences of digital solutions.
In addition to the enhanced digital platforms and specialized centers, ACIBADEM Healthcare Group is continuously investing in further advancements and research to extend its services. Collaboration with leaders in medical technology and innovation aims to integrate artificial intelligence, telehealth monitoring, and novel treatment modalities into everyday practice. This commitment to evolving with the healthcare landscape allows ACIBADEM to offer patients the latest care techniques and interventions, ensuring they receive effective and timely treatment.
The overarching mission of ACIBADEM Healthcare Group is to create a healthcare environment where every patient receives the best possible care. As part of this commitment to healthcare excellence, the organization actively pursues feedback from patients and ongoing collaborations with healthcare professionals to refine and enhance services continuously. ACIBADEM welcomes the opportunity to serve individuals from all walks of life, recognizing that every patient’s health journey is unique and deserving of individualized attention and effort.
In summary, the product update rolled out by ACIBADEM Healthcare Group includes an impressive array of expanded services focusing on telemedicine and digital healthcare solutions along with specialized medical centers. This initiative improves the accessibility and quality of healthcare while guaranteeing a personalized experience for every patient. With responsibilities to patients stretching beyond clinical care, ACIBADEM remains devoted to achieving the highest standards of healthcare excellence on a global scale, fostering a community where patients can trust they are receiving unparalleled care.
As ACIBADEM Health care Group embarks on this new chapter in its service offering, it invites current and prospective patients to explore the unprecedented healthcare solutions available, ensuring that quality care is always just a click away. The commitment to healthcare excellence, unwavering compassion, and innovative approaches to treatment remains at the core of ACIBADEM's philosophy, defining what it means to prioritize the health and wellness of every individual served

author: Redacción El País
title: La firma Moody’s abre la puerta a una posible rebaja de calificación para Colombia al cambiar la perspectiva de su nota crediticia de estable a negativa
text: Economía La firma Moody’s abre la puerta a una posible rebaja de calificación para Colombia al cambiar la perspectiva de su nota crediticia de estable a negativa La noticia se conoció en la tarde de este jueves 27 de junio de 2024. [Por: Redacción El País](/autor/redaccion-el-pais/) La firma Moody’s mantiene la calificación de Colombia en Baa2 en grado de inversión, pero determinó rebajar la perspectiva de estable a negativa. Lo anterior se da debido a las condiciones macroeconómicas retadoras que enfrenta el país que pueden impactar la consolidación fiscal, la tendencia de crecimiento, y el costo de endeudamiento, las cuales están asociadas con un débil crecimiento económico, un incremento sostenido en el costo de endeudamiento del país que podría deteriorar el manejo fiscal y el perfil crediticio del país hacia adelante. Por otro lado, esta calificadora de riesgo resalta como aspecto positivo la institucionalidad del país, que se traduce en el correcto funcionamiento de pesos y contrapesos. Asimismo, destaca que el Banco de la República sigue haciendo un manejo de la política monetaria de manera independiente. Sobre el Gobierno Nacional, Moody’s sostiene que este ha tenido la capacidad de demostrar para hacer recortes en el gasto con el fin de cumplir la regla fiscal, y mantener bajo control los niveles de deuda, en línea con sus pares. Para los expertos de la firma, el cambio en la perspectiva es el reflejo de complicaciones en la gestión fiscal por un crecimiento económico menor al esperado, el cual está afectando negativamente los ingresos tributarios, a lo que se suman mayores costos de endeudamiento, lo que en conjunto genera una presión adicional sobre las cuentas del Gobierno Nacional. “Estos factores están obstaculizando la capacidad actual y futura de las autoridades para cumplir la regla fiscal, al tiempo que aumentan el riesgo de un posible deterioro en el perfil crediticio de Colombia”, asegura un informe de Moody’s al respecto. En la parte del crecimiento, la firma considera que el aumento del ruido político y algunas decisiones políticas del Estado han contribuido a un sentimiento negativo entre los inversionistas. “La formación bruta de capital fijo disminuyó un 9,5 % y representó el 17,3 % del PIB en 2023, por debajo del promedio del 21,1 % durante 2013-2022. Aunque la actividad económica está mejorando en 2024, la persistente debilidad en la dinámica de inversión pesaría sobre una recuperación sostenida de las perspectivas de crecimiento a mediano plazo de Colombia, volviendo al crecimiento tendencial de alrededor del 3 %, y restringiría la capacidad de las autoridades para lograr una consolidación fiscal continua en 2025-2026″, precisan en el documento. Ante esto, el ministro de Hacienda, Ricardo Bonilla, se pronunció asegurando que “la calificadora de riesgo ha puesto un voto de confianza en el país, destacando las decisiones contundentes de recorte de gasto con el fin de mantener la sostenibilidad fiscal y macroeconómica que ha tomado el Gobierno del presidente Petro”. Noticia en desarrollo...

author: Getnews
title: Chen Zhiwen: From Financial Mastermind to Global Innovator
text: Chen Zhiwen: From Financial Mastermind to Global Innovator and Philanthropist From 2008 to 2012, he served as a senior analyst at Goldman Sachs Singapore Branch, focusing on gold market strategies during this period, helping the company achieve a net profit of more than US$100 million after the financial crisis. In 2014, he served as the head of blockchain solutions for Asia Pacific at DBS Bank. At Ripple Labs, Chen Zhiwen led the team to successfully promote cross-border payment solutions and facilitate cooperation with DBS Bank and HSBC. In 2017, after leaving DBS Bank, Chen Zhiwen founded the ZQ Investment Management Team and served as the team leader, leading the team to expand from Singapore to the global market. The company has achieved great success in the blockchain and gold foreign exchange markets through advanced AI trading systems and market strategies, and the team's fund management scale exceeds US$500 million. In 2019, Chen Zhiwen entered the US investment market and formed an investment team consisting of 20 senior industry elites, focusing on the North American investment market. Cooperation with many well-known companies in the United States and Canada has been reached. 2020-2023: The team expands its global business. The team members have reached more than 40 professional investment elites, and have cooperated with investment institutions in many countries around the world to successfully raise a large amount of funds. And launched an innovative AI science laboratory to help customers achieve efficient and accurate short-term transactions. In 2020, Chen Zhiwen was invited to join the Icahn Charitable Foundation and the Children's Aid Fund to provide financial assistance to poor families. Between 2019 and 2022, he established three educational institutions in New York and provided scholarship programs at Choate Rosemary Hall. He also manages Icahn House East, which provides assistance to the homeless in New York. Chen Zhiwen's successful investment journey has won him numerous honors. Chen Zhiwen is not only a leading figure in the financial field, but also an active philanthropist. Through innovative financial technology and charity projects, he helps improve the living standards of the world's poor and promotes the popularization and development of financial knowledge. author: Bradley Cox
title: Excelsior Hotel Ernst on the Right Path to a Greener Tomorrow
text: Excelsior Hotel Ernst on the Right Path to a Greener Tomorrow Family owned since 1863, the hotel has ensured that it keeps pace with the latest sustainable luxury practices. Each initiative, especially our ReBubble and Wings Coin projects, show our deep commitment to the planet and prove that we are on the right path to a greener tomorrow.”SANTA MONICA, CALIFORNIA, UNITED STATES, July 5, 2024 / — Managing Director, Georg Plesser [EINPresswire.com](https://www.einpresswire.com/)/ -- The Excelsior Hotel Ernst in Cologne was recently recertified by [Green Globe](https://www.greenglobe.com/)for the third year. For over 160 years, the Excelsior Hotel Ernst has been welcoming guests through its doors right opposite Cologne Cathedral, in the heart of Cologne’s Old Town. Family owned since 1863, the hotel has ensured that it keeps pace with the latest sustainable luxury practices. Managing Director, Georg Plesser, expressed his pride and optimism saying, “In securing Green Globe certification once more, we're not just honored, we're energized! Each initiative, especially our ReBubble and Wings Coin projects, show our deep commitment to the planet and prove that we are on the right path to a greener tomorrow.” Among Excelsior Hotel Ernst’s sustainability achievements from the past year, two projects stand out, reflecting the hotel’s efforts toward making a positive impact on the planet. Firstly, the ReBubble – the social soap initiative continues to make significant strides. Each year, all soap remnants are collected which are then processed and sold anew. This innovative project not only reduces waste but also contributes to the circular economy, showcasing the hotel’s commitment to sustainability in every aspect of its operations. Furthermore, ReBubble works with the Aachen Lebenshilfe workshop that provides employment opportunities for people with disabilities thereby imbuing the soap with a special emotional value as well. Secondly, a collaboration with Wings Coin has introduced a transformative approach to housekeeping operations. Since 2023, guests have had the option to forgo room cleaning, supporting Excelsior Hotel Ernst’s sustainability strategy. Through this partnership, a total of 460 opt-outs were recorded last year alone. Significant resource savings were made through this initiative including more than 346 kW/h in electricity consumption, water savings of 22.5 liters, 728 kg in CO2, over 1762 kg in bed linen, towels and cleaning cloths, and 50 liters of cleaning supplies. The eco-conscious program also empowers guests to participate in environmental efforts at the hotel. The non-profit organization Project Wings receives support for each cancelled room cleaning service. The organization’s environmental protection projects include the world’s largest recycling village in Indonesia, implementation of waste management systems, species protection and nature conservation. “Both projects are spearheaded by a dedicated Green Team, demonstrating a collective commitment to our sustainable future. The Green Globe recognition fuels our motivation to continue our green journey!” said Mr Plesser. Contact Britta Funke Director PR & Marketing Excelsior Hotel Ernst E britta.funke@excelsior-hotel-ernst.de T + 49 (0) 221 270 3157 F + 49 (0) 221 270 3333 [www.excelsiorhotelernst.de](https://www.excelsiorhotelernst.com/) Bradley Cox Green Globe + +1 310-337-3000 [email us here](http://www.einpresswire.com/contact_author/725085275) Visit us on social media:
